Batteries are just their beginning. https://t.co/Sk7n9jP2Ke

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not just us, it's all the kids that make the conscious effort to go out to their communities and say I see something wrong.‚Äú https://t.co/WGXHFQHclU

‚ÄúClimate change has become a new reality for people because we see its effects so imminently. I want to give back to my community and educate people on why these issues are so important and why we should all take a more serious approach." - Anika

Recycle My Battery volunteers like Shyam and Anika have been working with local schools to set up battery recycling bins while spreading awareness of their importance. https://t.co/MtBBhEpyUs

Recycle My Battery is a nonprofit organization run by elementary, middle & high school students that educates communities on why it's important to properly recycle batteries, avoiding landfill fires that create toxic chemicals and pose a serious threat to human health.

49 years ago, the Supreme Court issued its historic ruling in Roe v. Wade, promising women the safety and freedom to make their own choices about their bodies and health.
